cards.front: What are Newton's three laws of motion?
cards.back: 1. An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by a net external force. 2. The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass. (F=ma) 3. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

questions.stem: What is the third law of motion, also known as the action-reaction principle?
options: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction in the direction opposite to the first.
The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it.
An object in motion will remain in motion unless acted upon by another force.
The momentum of an object is conserved during collisions.
questions.rationale: According to Newton's third law, 'For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction in the direction opposite to the first.'

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion Insight
insights.takeaway: Newton's three laws describe the relationship between a body and the forces acting upon it, and are fundamental to understanding physics in terms of motion, mass, and force.
